intro: Pentanisia rhodesiana, commonly known as the Rhodesian pentanisia, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its erect, hairy stems and showy, five-petaled flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. The species is of interest in botanical studies due to its unique morphology and ecological adaptations.
